intro: Medicago hispida f. microdon, commonly known as the hairy vetch, is a perennial legume native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces and small, yellow pea-like flowers. The plant has a robust root system that helps in nitrogen fixation, making it valuable for soil enrichment. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Its adaptability and ecological benefits make it a useful plant in both agricultural and ornamental settings.
